title: How to Play Hide and Seek in the Dark (Inside)

steps.headline: Turn all lights off.
steps.description: It's pretty self-explanatory. Cover up any computer lights, such as the mouse light, or any other lights.

steps.headline: Clean the floor.
steps.description: Make sure you pick up every thing you can trip over. Also make sure you pick up all laundry baskets; if you kick them, it can hurt badly.

steps.headline: Gather a group of friends, or family members.
steps.description: After you do that, say something like "1 2 3 NOT IT!" or do "Bubble Gum Bubble Gum in a Dish", or something like that to decide who is "it".

steps.headline: Play in an area, like a huge basement, where you will have plenty of space to hide.
Do things such as count to a number that the hiders pick.
steps.description: Make sure it is enough time so the hiders can hide.

steps.headline: When you get to the area where everyone is hiding, listen closely; something as simple as breathing can give away a person's hiding spot.
Look closely.
steps.description: If something looks unusual, like a big, tall spot on the wall, it is most likely a hider.

steps.headline: Be careful.
steps.description: Feel around just in case you missed something while you were cleaning.

steps.headline: When you think you've found someone, tag them.
steps.description: Feel around their body to make sure it is a person (not to the point where they're uncomfortable).

steps.headline: Once the tagger tags someone, it's their turn to be the tagger.
Being a hider can be fun, but tricky.
steps.description: Make sure you hide somewhere that the tagger would most likely miss, or somewhere SO obvious that the tagger wouldn't even think to look there.

steps.headline: When the tagger is near you, TRY YOUR BEST not to laugh or breathe heavily.
steps.description: Stay calm and quiet so they move forward to another place.

steps.headline: Don't hide by anyone.
steps.description: This has to do with trust. If you completely trust someone, go ahead and hide with them. But, if you don't trust them and you believe that they will laugh or make a loud noise to give you away, don't hide near them.

text: Steps Turn all lights off. It's pretty self-explanatory. Cover up any computer lights, such as the mouse light, or any other lights. Clean the floor. Make sure you pick up every thing you can trip over. Also make sure you pick up all laundry baskets; if you kick them, it can hurt badly. Gather a group of friends, or family members. After you do that, say something like "1 2 3 NOT IT!" or do "Bubble Gum Bubble Gum in a Dish", or something like that to decide who is "it". Play in an area, like a huge basement, where you will have plenty of space to hide.  Tagger Do things such as count to a number that the hiders pick. Make sure it is enough time so the hiders can hide. When you get to the area where everyone is hiding, listen closely; something as simple as breathing can give away a person's hiding spot.  Look closely. If something looks unusual, like a big, tall spot on the wall, it is most likely a hider. Be careful. Feel around just in case you missed something while you were cleaning. When you think you've found someone, tag them. Feel around their body to make sure it is a person (not to the point where they're uncomfortable). Once the tagger tags someone, it's their turn to be the tagger.  Hider Being a hider can be fun, but tricky. Make sure you hide somewhere that the tagger would most likely miss, or somewhere SO obvious that the tagger wouldn't even think to look there. When the tagger is near you, TRY YOUR BEST not to laugh or breathe heavily. Stay calm and quiet so they move forward to another place. Don't hide by anyone. This has to do with trust. If you completely trust someone, go ahead and hide with them. But, if you don't trust them and you believe that they will laugh or make a loud noise to give you away, don't hide near them.
